results.title: A Country practice: the wedding
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Lynn Bayonas and JNP Films
results.brief_description: Television soaps are famous for their elaborate funerals, births and weddings, and long-running Australian favourite “A Country Practice” was no different. This episode features the long awaited wedding of city doctor Simon Bowen to local vet Vicky Dean. Between last minute patient emergencies and an injured horse requiring urgent attention, locals wonder - will Simon and Vicky make it to the church on time?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brendan Maher, Lynn Bayonas and JNP Films

results.title: A Composition in steel by Todd Pendleton with Jack Pendleton
results.creator_credit: James Klebau and James Klebau Productions
results.brief_description: The film shows the two Pendleton brothers, Todd and Jack, making a steel sculpture starting from the initial design in chalk on a metal base, then the selection, cutting and the beating of the scrap metal to shape. Finally they weld the shapes together modifying the design as they go.

results.title: A City in the country: Albury Wodonga development
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: With forty-two percent of the Australia’s population in Sydney and Melbourne, there is a need for decentralization. Because of this, the government has acted to create a new growth area near the border of Victoria and New South Wales. This film studies the many factors involved in planning a new community.

results.title: A Cosmic christmas
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Nelvana and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a small town rediscovers the real spirit of Christmas thanks to three alien visitors from outer space and a little boy named Peter. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: A Chord for voices
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Malcolm Otton, OTC Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In July 1976 a new undersea communications link was completed between Papua New Guinea, Australia and the rest of the world. Complicated cable laying techniques are shown, and in the background is the exotic and beautiful Papua New Guinea scenery. By plugging in to the international community, the indigenous people will feel greater pressure to surrender their traditions and customs, and to develop towards a more cosmopolitan way of life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Chinese ghost story III = Sinnui yauman III [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Golden Princess Films
results.brief_description: ‘The Chinese Ghost Story’ series integrates ideas and images from Western horror films (using techniques and technologies developed in the Cinefex Workshop), with those from a classical Chinese story by Pu Song-Ling. In this part the Tree Devil from the first two parts wakes after a hundred-year sleep. Buddhism has gained its following in the Jiang hu (‘vagrant world’), a turbulent society ‘without rules’. A high priest and student monk are the custodians of a Sacred Golden Buddha which is transmogrified in the haunted Orchid Temple. The monks also go through changes as they encounter alluring demonesses and put the Tree Devil to the sword. Cast includes Tony Leung, Jacky Cheung and Wang Hsu Hsien. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Child is born
results.brief_description: Traces the relationship between a young wife and her husband from the time that they decide to have children to the birth and homecoming of their first child. Shows the development of the foetus using live photography and the actual birth of the child, capturing the blend of pain and joy in life’s most miraculous moment. Adapted from the film “Barnet (the child)” produced by Skandia Insurance Company, Stockholm. Narrated by Mary S. Caldesone.

results.title: A Continuing responsibility
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Barrie Howells, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced as part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organising communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. As demonstrated in the Woodland Organisation in Chicago, Alinsky’s technique creates ongoing organisations firmly rooted in the community.

results.title: A Conceptual approach to teaching
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith, Education Dept of South Australia and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The problems presented by what is popularly called “the information explosion” are no more keenly felt than by teachers and students. This film appraises current teaching methodology and provides a basis for discussion to provoke new thoughts and ideas on teaching techniques. Designed as an in-service aid for re-assessing and re-evaluating teaching programs and methodologies and provide a starting point for curriculum development.
